decision_conditions:
1) The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and details: Drawing numbers: 3120 PL01; 3120 PL02D; 3120 PL03B; 3120 PL04F; 3120 PL05E; 3120 PL16-1D; 3120 PL16-2D; 3120 PL16-3D; 3120 PL16-4D; 3120 PL16-5C. Noise Impact Assessment R5781-1 Rev0 dated 2 July 2015 prepared by 24 Acoustics.
2) Notwithstanding condition 2, no development shall take place until full details of the following elements of the development hereby approved have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority:
i) the obscure screens to be installed to the proposed balconies;
ii) the obscure glazing to be installed to the external stairs on the rear elevation of the proposed building;
iii) measures for screening views from the terraces to the first floor Flat 1 and Flat 2 to prevent overlooking from the terraces to the windows serving the bedroom 2 of first floor Flat 2 and between the terraces to first floor Flats 1 and 2;
These works shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and be completed before any of the apartments hereby approved are occupied.
3) Notwithstanding condition 2, no development shall take place until an amended plan showing details of a revised site layout providing for a maximum of 20 on-site parking spaces has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved plan and details.
4) Notwithstanding condition 2, no development shall take place until details have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority of measures to limit the extent to which the south west facing first and second floor windows serving the living/kitchen/dining room and bedroom 2 of Flats 1 and 7 can be opened. The windows shall be installed in accordance with the agreed details and shall be glazed with obscure glazing.
5) No development shall take place until a schedule of the materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the building hereby permitted have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.
6) No development shall take place until details of both hard and soft landscape works have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. These details shall include means of enclosure to the site boundaries; vehicle and pedestrian access and circulation areas; the forecourt area to the retail/commercial unit and entrance to the apartments including details of the feature trees proposed in this area; hard surfacing materials; planting within the shared private amenity space and to the site boundaries; the identification of and management works to existing trees and other vegetation to be retained; minor artefacts and structures.
All hard landscaping works shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and shall be completed before any part of the development is occupied or brought into use.
All new planting shall be carried in the first planting and/ or seeding season following the first occupation of any part of the development and shall comply with the requirements specified in BS3936 (1992) ‘Specification of Nursery Stock Part 1 Trees and Shrubs’ and in BS4428 (1989) ‘Recommendations for General Landscape Operations’. None of the new trees, plants or shrubs planted shall be lopped or topped within a period of 5 years from the completion of the development. Any trees, plants or shrubs which, within a period of 5 years from the completion of the development, die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased, shall be replaced in the next planting season, in accordance with the approved scheme. The approved landscaping scheme shall be maintained thereafter.
7) No development shall take place until a scheme for the protection of existing trees to be retained on or adjoining the north-western (rear) boundary of the site has been submitted and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The scheme shall be designed in accordance with BS 5837 (2012) Trees in Relation to Design, Development and Construction and the approved measures shall be undertaken before any work in connection with the development hereby permitted is commenced and shall be retained for the duration of the construction works on the site.
8) No development shall take place until an assessment of the risks posed by any ground contamination has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. This assessment must be undertaken by a suitably qualified contaminated land practitioner, in accordance with British Standard BS 10175: Investigation of potentially contaminated sites - Code of Practice and the Environment Agency’s Model Procedures for the Management of Land Contamination (CLR 11) (or equivalent British Standard and Model Procedures if replaced), and shall assess any contamination on the site, whether or not it originates on the site.
The assessment shall include: a desk top study and site reconnaissance to identify potential sources of contamination; a site investigation to characterise the nature and likely extent of any contamination; and the preparation of a site investigation report, including proposals for a remedial scheme to render the site fit for the proposed use and details of any risk assessments as may be needed in support of the scheme. The scheme shall include a programme setting out the sequence of any remediation works required in relation to the development works and shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details and programme of works.
A validation report, prepared by a suitably qualified person, which provides verification of the implementation and completion of the approved remediation works and risk assessments shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority before any residential unit hereby approved is first occupied. The validation report shall include verification of the quality of any imported soil.
If, during the course of the construction programme, any contamination is discovered which was not previously identified in the site investigation report the details of the nature and extent of that contamination and proposals for its removal or treatment shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. Any additional remediation works shall be completed in accordance with the agreed details prior to the first occupation of any residential unit hereby approved.
9) No development shall take place, including any works of demolition, until a Construction Method Statement has been submitted to, and approved in writing by, the local planning authority. The approved Statement shall be adhered to throughout the construction period. The Statement shall provide for:
i) The hours of work for demolition and construction activities on the site and the hours for making deliveries of materials and for the removal of wastes from the site;
ii) traffic routes for construction and delivery vehicles;
iii) the parking of vehicles of site operatives and visitors;
iv) loading and unloading of plant and materials;
v) storage of plant and materials used in constructing the development;
vi) the erection and maintenance of security hoardings including decorative displays and facilities for public viewing, where appropriate;
vii) wheel washing facilities and measures for cleaning the public highway;
viii) measures to control the emission of dust and dirt during construction;
ix) measures to control the emission of noise from construction activities;
x) a scheme for recycling/disposing of waste resulting from demolition and construction works.
10) Notwithstanding the details submitted with the application no development shall take place until details have been submitted and approved in writing by the local planning authority of the measures to be taken to ensure the proposed commercial and residential waste collection bins will be separated to prevent waste streams being merged. The measures approved shall be undertaken at the site before any part of the development hereby permitted is first occupied or brought into use and shall be retained thereafter.
11) No development shall take place until a scheme for protecting the proposed residential apartments from noise from the ground floor commercial unit and from other external noise sources has been submitted and approved in writing by the local planning authority; all works which form part of the approved scheme shall be completed before any of the residential apartments hereby approved are first occupied.
12) No development shall take place until a scheme for the provision and implementation of transport improvements in the vicinity of the site has been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The scheme shall include proposal for the control of on-street loading and parking; the details of works to improve the vehicular access to the site and resultant reinstatement and /or improvement of the public footway and how the treatment and planting to the proposed forecourt would tie in with the existing public realm; and details of a Traffic Regulation Order to facilitate the necessary controls and restrictions on parking and loading. All works within the approved scheme shall be carried out in accordance with the details approved and shall be completed prior to the first occupation or use of any part of the development hereby approved.
13) No part of the development hereby approved shall be occupied until a Car Parking Management Plan has been submitted to and approved in writing by thelocal planning authority. The Plan shall include details of how the residential parking spaces will be allocated; details of charging facilities for electric vehicles in line with London Plan Policy 6.13, and details of the provision of disabled parking in line with Policy T5 of the London Borough of Redbridge Core Strategy. All measures approved as part of the agreed Plan shall be implemented in accordance with the agreed details and shall be retained thereafter.
14) Prior to the first occupation of the commercial unit hereby permitted, a Service Management Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The Plan shall detail the proposals for the servicing of the unit by delivery vehicles including the size and type of vehicles to be used, the times at which service vehicles are expected to visit the unit and the means by which they will access and leave the site. Any measures set out in the approved scheme shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details and shall be retained thereafter.
15) The secure cycle storage and waste collection bin storage facilities indicated on Drawing No 3120 PL0D shall be constructed and be available for use prior to the first occupation of any part of the development and shall be retained exclusively for use for these purposes thereafter.
16) The ground floor commercial unit hereby permitted shall be used for retail (Use Class A1) use and for no other purpose or use.
17) The ground floor commercial unit hereby permitted shall not be open outside of the following hours:
06:00-22:00 on Mondays to Fridays
07:00-18:00 on Saturdays
09.00-16.00 Sundays and Bank Holidays.
18) No goods shall be delivered to or despatched from the site in association with the Class A1 retail use hereby permitted outside of the hours of 08.00-17.00 Mondays to Saturdays or at any time on Sundays or Bank Holidays.
19) The residential units hereby permitted shall be constructed to meet the requirements of Category 2 of the National Standard for Housing Design as set out in the Approved Document M 2015 ‘Accessible and Adaptable Dwellings’ M4 (2) and a minimum of 10% of the units shall be wheelchair accessible.
20) The ‘as built’ stage Building Regulations Output Document from approved software shall be submitted to the local planning authority within 1 month of the first occupation of any of the residential units hereby permitted, to confirm that the development has achieved a minimum 35% improvement in carbon emissions on Part L of the 2013 Building Regulations.
21) The development hereby approved shall be designed to meet a water consumption target of 105 litres of water per person per day.
22) Notwithstanding the details submitted on the application no photovoltaic equipment shall be installed at the site other than in accordance with details which have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.
description: Variation of (Condition 12) and (Condition 18) of approved planning permission 1856/15: scheme for protecting the proposed residential apartments from noise, and opening hours of commercial unit. (Summary)
